titleStmt.title: The descripcion of the sphere or the frame of the worlde, right worthy to be red and studyed on, of all noble wyttes, specially of all those that be desyrous to attayne any perfecte knowledge in cosmography, or true descripcion of reagions, townes, or countrees, / set forth by Proclus Diadochus, and Englysshed by wyllyam [sic] Salysbury..
Sphaera. English. 1550
titleStmt.author: Proclus, ca. 410-485.
Salesbury, William, 1520?-1600 ?

notesStmt.note: Imprint information from colophon which reads: Jmprynted by me Robert Wyer. Jn the yere of our Lorde GOD a. M.D.L. dwellyng at the sygne of saynt Joh√± Euangelist, in saynt Martyns parysshe besyde Charynge crosse. And fynysshed the .xi. daye of Februarie. Cum priuilegio, ad imprimendum solum.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
